meanings.definition: Marses (verb): third person singular present of 'mars'
meanings.sent1: He marses through the forest, looking for his lost dog.
meanings.sent2: She always marses to the park on Sundays for a picnic.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel marses around the tree, trying to find the perfect nut.
meanings.sent4: Time marses on, never stopping for anyone.
meanings.sent5: The river marses steadily towards the sea, carrying all it meets along the way.

meanings.sent1: The explorers discovered many mysterious marses on their journey.
meanings.sent2: The telescope revealed countless bright marses in the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The children collected colorful marses from the beach to build a sandcastle.
meanings.sent4: The artist painted a beautiful landscape with rolling green marses.
meanings.sent5: The garden was filled with blooming marses of all shapes and sizes.
